Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 09:57AM Lisa68 wrote: If you are at high risk the insurance company has to pay for the MRI.  You should be able to appeal the claim and the physician may have to submit further documentation of why the MRI was requested.  I have BCBS also and had a MRI 2-26-09.  My claim is still pending but I am confident it will be paid 100% as I am high risk. It may just take some time for them to settle it. Good Luck! Lisa
Posts.Title: Insurance company will not cover my MRI blas dlb823

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 06:00AM Lisa68 wrote: Try UT Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas.  They are a Center of Excellence for Breast Care. http://www.utsouthwestern.edu/patientcare/medicalservices/cancer/breast.html Good Luck!  Lisa
Posts.Title: Dallas, Tx recommendations LeighLeigh LeighLeigh

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 05:33AM Lisa68 wrote: I had a wire localization before my excisional biopsy... the wire placement was done at 8am and surgery was scheduled for 10am but delayed until almost 1pm. They tape the wire down so it really isn't that noticable or uncomfortable.  Most likely you will ck in to the day surgery a hour or two before your scheduled surgery... a book would be a good plan.  Good Luck! Lisa
Posts.Title: Time lapse between wire localization & excisional biopsy.... mrs-mjt mrs-mjt

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 01:19PM Lisa68 wrote: My husband drove me from the breast center on our large medical campus to the hospital on campus where I had surgery.  Didn't have to stay in a gown... but I did make sure to wear loose fitting clothes for comfort.
Posts.Title: Time lapse between wire localization & excisional biopsy.... mrs-mjt mrs-mjt

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2009 08:35PM - edited Mar 11, 2009 08:14PM by Lisa68 I had my first baseline mammogram at age 35. Had my first annual mammo at 40. I was recalled because there had been a change.  The next mammo confirmed microcalcifications and I had stereotactic biopsy that same day (2/3/09) and ADH was found.  On 2/26/09 I had a Breast MRI w/ die contrast.  The results were no suspicious findings.  On 3/3/09 I had a excisional biopsy and I am extremely thankful to say I do have ADH but the biopsy revealed only fibrocystic changes. I will have follow-up mammograms every 6 months and see my Onc surgeon after Mammos.  I believe I will continue annually to have the MRI.  My surgeon offered me Tamoxifen... but I don't feel that I am ready for that yet.  Five years ago at the age of 58 my mother had DCIS stage 0.  However, the only followup recomended after her excisional biopsy was mammo every 6 months.  We have requested my moms pathology reports because she was never given a copy.  This will be an important key for both of us. Lisa68
